first_tap_info_flight_desc: You can tap here or pinch to take off or land, and pan to move. You can also travel around in the real world to move, but be mindful of your surroundings.
first_tap_info_spellcasting_desc: Casting a damaging spell on a witch will cause them to become immune to you. That immunity lifts only after they cast back or enough time passes for it to wear off. Some places, like gardens, will have immunity disabled.
first_tap_info_quickcasting_desc: You can set certain spells to be quickcast here. Spells that require ingredients to be cast can be added as well, and will automatically use the ingredients, if you have them. You can tap and hold on a slot to change the selected spell.
first_tap_info_energy_desc: You can gain energy in many ways, such as by collecting Energy Nodes around the world. You use energy to cast spells, but beware. You will die if you have no energy left.
first_tap_info_ingredients_desc: You have a decent collection of ingredients already, witch, but you should always be searching for more. Ingredients will make your spells incredibly more potent.
first_tap_info_summoning_desc: You can summon many wild and exotic spirits once you have gained knowledge of them by defeating them. You must have the required ingredients and energy to do so, but beware of using Forbidden Tools...
first_tap_info_empower_desc: Tap here to open your inventory and add ingredients to your spell, before you cast it. Some ingredients will have profound effects on your spells, increasing their efficiency, duration, and more.
first_tap_info_coven_desc: Here you can search for and join a coven, as well as manage your coven once you are invited or create one. Every witch is stronger in a coven. You can only have 13 witches in a coven.
first_tap_info_bos_desc: Here you can see more information about yourself, as well as the spirits you have gained knowledge of, the spirits you have summoned and are active, and the spells you can one day master, with enough practice of course.
first_tap_info_daily_desc: Here you can see what the Grey Hand requires of you today. These tasks reward Silver Drachs, and can even sometimes reward a Gold Drach.
first_tap_info_recall_desc: When you are tired of exploring the world in Spirit Form, you can tap this to return quickly to your Physical Form.
first_tap_info_shout_desc: Shouting is similar to chatting with other players, however it is only visible to those near to you, and only lasts a short time.
first_tap_info_tier_desc: Spirits are fascinating and unique in many ways, and they are all broken up into Tiers. These Tiers go in order from weakest to strongest; Lesser, Greater, Superior, and Legendary. The weaker the spirit, the more common it is but the stronger a spirit, the more rare it is.
first_tap_info_greyhand_desc:
Explore the world. Gather items to empower your magics. Banish spirits and practice your spells on other witches.
All of these things will prepare you to battle in the world’s many Places of Power and rise among the ranks of a new generation of witches.
first_tap_info_nextpopftf_desc: If you wish to try your hand in a Place of Power, the next battle begins at {nextPoPName} in {nextPoPTime}, tap on the Place of Power icon in the top right to investigate.
first_tap_info_nextpoplaunch_desc: If you wish to try your hand in a Place of Power, the next battle begins at {nextPoPName} in {nextPoPTime}, tap on the Place of Power icon in the top right to investigate.
first_tap_info_moonphase_desc: Moon Phases affect the strength of magic. The spells cast by a witch who follows the White Path will grow stronger with the full moon. Spells of witches following the Shadow Path will find strength in the darkness of a new moon. This is reflected in your overall Spell Efficiency.
spell_sunEater_desc: Deals 5 to 50 damage to target. LEVEL REQUIREMENT: {{levelRequired}}
spell_resurrection_desc: Revives a target in a death state, granting them 10 to 40 energy multiplied by caster level. LEVEL REQUIREMENT: {{levelRequired}}
spell_whiteFlame_desc: Deals 50 to 70 damage to target. LEVEL REQUIREMENT: {{levelRequired}}
spell_grace_desc: Revives a target in a death state, granting them 20 to 80 energy multiplied by caster level. LEVEL REQUIREMENT: {{levelRequired}}
spell_dispel_desc: Removes 1 negative condition from your target. LEVEL REQUIREMENT: {{levelRequired}}
spell_greaterDispel_desc: Removes all negative conditions on the target. LEVEL REQUIREMENT: {{levelRequired}}
spell_banish_desc: Sends the target to a random location in spirit form. LEVEL REQUIREMENT: {{levelRequired}}
spell_leech_desc: Target takes 100 to 300 damage, caster then receives one half of the damage given. Can only be cast once every 20 minutes. LEVEL REQUIREMENT: {{levelRequired}}
spell_burst_desc: Deals 200 to 280 damage, with a 50% chance of critical strike. Critical strike will double the damage. LEVEL REQUIREMENT: {{levelRequired}}
spell_lazurus_desc: Revives a target and grants them 200 to 300 energy. Target's resilience is set to caster's level for 1 minute. LEVEL REQUIREMENT: {{levelRequired}}
spell_wail_desc: Banishes a target to a random location in the world. Deals between 10 and 300 damage, based on how far away the witch is thrown. Can only be cast on witches. LEVEL REQUIREMENT: {{levelRequired}}
spell_trueSight_desc: Reveals hidden witches, places of power, spirits and items within 3 kilometers. DURATION: 1 hour. REQUIRES GREY ALIGNMENT. LEVEL REQUIREMENT: {{levelRequired}}
spell_crowsEye_desc: Reveals hidden witches, places of power, spirits and items worldwide. DURATION: 1 hour. REQUIRES GREY ALIGNMENT. LEVEL REQUIREMENT: {{levelRequired}}
spell_channeling_desc: For every second a witch channels, they gain +1 Power, +1 Resilience, and +1 crit rate %. They cannot channel any further past {witch level} seconds. Status change expires after a spell is cast. LEVEL REQUIREMENT: {{levelRequired}}
spell_addledMind_desc: Has a small chance to interrupt a witch while channeling. LEVEL REQUIREMENT: {{levelRequired}}
spell_hex_lore: Since its discovery by John Dee, this Hex has proven tried and true and perfectly safe for modern witches.
spell_sunEater_lore: Refined by witches over time, this spell was an accidental discovery of Helvetius in his pursuit to transmute lead into gold.
spell_bind_lore: Most assign this simple and dependable variation of the binding spell to Aradia herself, as it was first used by the Italian Benandanti under her guidance in the Ember Wars.
spell_resurrection_lore: Why mess with perfection? We owe the Voodoo Sisters for this brand of resurrection. Crafted by the bayou queen Marie Laveau in the mid nineteenth-century.
spell_bless_lore: This particular spell adopts the poorly kept secrets of Abremelin the Mage concerning the transmutation of the sun's power into magical energy.
spell_silence_lore: Little magic can be used without the spoken word. This version of silence is a secret stolen from the dark Cimmerian Shades that are so adept at silencing trespassers upon their shore.
spell_whiteFlame_lore: Shared willingly by the Rosicrucian mystics, this lance of light is believed to be cast from the heart of divine man.
spell_grace_lore: Said to be written on the walls of the Atlantean Mystery Temple, this powerful spell of restoration has little changed over the centuries.
spell_seal_lore: This remarkably complicated seal was discovered by a not so remarkable herbalist and pharmacologist living in Detroit. He gifted the seal to the Grey Hand coven in 1958 signing it simply as Mr. Davidson.
spell_invisibility_lore: For all the power and practical use of invisibility, it is not a complicated spell. This particular version has been chosen by the Grey Hand coven for its relative safety. More ambitious versions run the risk of permanent displacement from the visible world.
spell_dispel_lore: The Egyptian Book of the Dead is a trove of wisdom for knowing witches. The dead must be cleansed to traverse the Underworld. This spell is informed by those secret Egyptian rituals.
spell_clarity_lore: Grants the target the tranquility of still waters, increasing their chance to hit. Assigned to many authors from a Master Mason to a scribe in the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn to an earthen vessel found among the ruins of Solomon's Temple.
spell_sealBalance_lore: The secret of this balancing spell was hidden for years behind an alchemical cryptogram until it was found deciphered among the papers of John Wilkins, a seventeenth century Bishop of Chester and alleged agent of the Sons of Enoch.
spell_sealLight_lore: Assigned to many authors from a Master Mason to a scribe within the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn to an earthen vessel found among the ruins of Solomon's Temple. Either way, works like a charm.
spell_sealShadow_lore: Discovered first among the mutilated Hermetic fragments, this spell was once cast by the Singers of ancient Eqypt in their musical spellcraft. It has been carefully altered by the Grey Hand coven for modern witches.
spell_reflectiveWard_lore: The philosopher mages of the Alexandrian School of Neo-Platonism came under many magical attacks. Hypatia herself crafted this defensive spell to protect her disciples.
spell_rageWard_lore: Comte di Cagliostro suffered dearly for all his magical genius. He left this spell upon the wall of the Inquisitional dungeon in San Leo. The effect, he claimed, strengthened him against his tormentors.
spell_greaterSeal_lore: Threefold the power of your common Seal.
spell_greaterBless_lore: Threefold the power of your common Bless.
spell_greaterHex_lore: Threefold the power of your common Hex.
spell_greaterDispel_lore: This is the full measure of your power to Dispel.
spell_banish_lore: Instantly cast your target to some remote region of the world. A favorite Signature of the gamesome witches of the Seven Hills coven. Designed as a spell of teleportation, this unintentional version was found in an esoteric volume stolen from the library of John Dee.
spell_wither_lore: This Signature spell was found somewhere in the esoteric doctrine of the Druids. Masters of all binding magic, the target feels as if they are bound with briars, the pain dulling their wits.
spell_foolBargain_lore: The notorious psychopomp known as the Prince of Merchants sold this Signature to human witches when our war with vampires was at it's most violent. Like most dealings with the Prince, the price is always steep for immediate gains.
spell_leech_lore: It is recited by the Sons of Enoch that the Chaldeans held dominion over Babylon, albeit briefly, on the strength of their vampire houses. These houses were known to practice powerful blood magic. While this Signature requires no blood, it's psychic properties are just as strong as the Chaldean variety.
spell_confusion_lore: A favorite of the Hermetic orders, nothing delights a trickster witch like addling the mind of their target. Pythagoris stumbled upon this Signature in his study of symmetrical geometric solids. It has remained unchanged in the Grey Hand grimoire.
spell_burst_lore: The wonder mirrors of Japan served as little more than curiosities until one was discovered to reveal a secret pattern that informed the Signature of this powerful spell.
spell_lazurus_lore: Raise a target from the dead, and shield them with an aura of protection.
spell_shadowfeet_lore: Bring a target from the binds of Death and grant them firm Resilience for several minutes. However, target will also take damage over time.
spell_wail_lore: Jack Fiddler, the notorious witch that made his name banishing Wendigos, was taught the secret of stealing their unearthly screams by a mysterious Cree medicine girl only known as Kanti. It is from her wisdom that we craft this Signature.
spell_trueSight_lore: Another gift of Zhang Guolao, this spell is believed to be the accidental result of crafting a spell alleviating the need for sleep.
spell_crowsEye_lore: Another gift of Zhang Guolao, this spell is believed to be the accidental result of crafting a spell alleviating the need for sleep.
spell_twilightDusk_lore: One of the minor offerings of Zhang Guolao to the canon of witchcraft, this spell is believed to be the accidental result of crafting a spell for shapeshifting into a bat.
spell_shadowMark_lore: This curse was found upon a tablet during Woolley’s excavation at Ur in the 1920's. It was then adapted into spellcraft by the Glorious 99, a Hive of witches that thrived in Iran until their mysterious undoing in the late 60's. Beware, it is a tricky spell with a tendancy to backfire.
spell_twilightDawn_lore: Another gift of Zhang Guolao, this spell is believed to be the accidental result of crafting a spell alleviating the need for sleep.

spellcasting_title: Making the most of your spells
money_title: How to earn silver and gold
moon_title: How the moon influences your energy
savannahGrey_title: Savannah Grey and the Grey Hand Coven
mainui_desc: Let's take a tour of the main user interface of Covens.
fly_desc: Of course you can fly! Let's learn flight and the important difference between Spirit and Physical form.
summoning_desc: How to summon Otherworldly spirits and the rule that must not be broken.
spellcasting_desc: Witchcraft is not simple sorcery! Here we learn the old ways of wielding magic and how to make the most of ingredients.
path_desc: Let's learn how your spell choices influence your alignment. And how your alignment effects the spells you cast.
energy_desc: Don't get stranded with no energy. Learn how to rejuvenate your magical essence.
money_desc: Silver and Gold are used to buy elixirs, gear and specialty items. Let's learn how witches accumulate wealth.
tribunal_desc: Let's learn about the seasonal tournaments, the rewards and the leaderboards.
store_desc: How to deal with our illustrious gypsy-sage Madame Fortuna, trader of all things witchy.
wardrobe_desc: How to enjoy the hundreds of cosmetic variations a witch can have.
inventory_desc: Collecting and keeping track of your botanicals, tools, gems and unique items.
moon_desc: Every day is different in Covens. Let's learn how the moon effects your magical energy.
covens_desc: Learn how Covens work and how working with others can benefit you greatly!
bos_desc: The Book of Shadows is very personal to every witch. You can find a collection of your magical learning.
conditions_desc: Spell casting can leave some lasting effects on other witches. Learn which spells can help or hurt others!
pop_desc: Controlling Places of Power is a great way to help your coven, earn noteriety, and claim rewards.
deck_desc: Let's learn how to control Otherworldly spirits and summon them from you Spirit Deck.
portals_desc: Let's learn what portals mean and how to interact with them.
dailies_desc: A witch's work is never done. Daily quests can earn you easy rewards.
savannahGrey_desc: She's been called the mother of modern witchcraft. Who is Savannah Grey and what does the Grey Hand Coven mean to you?
ftf_0: Savannah Grey: “You’re all alone witch. Let’s teach you how to protect yourself.”
ftf_1: Savannah Grey: “The Barghest is a spectral hound that can act as a familiar to witches, but before you can summon it, you must defeat it in battle.”
ftf_2: Savannah Grey: “Tap on the Barghest to select it.”
ftf_3: Savannah Grey: “I will weaken the Barghest for you.”
ftf_4: Savannah Grey: “Let's use a spell from the Shadow School to capture this Barghest.”
ftf_5: Savannah Grey: “This is your spellbook. You can tap these glyphs to sort your spells by the three schools of magic; White, Grey, and Shadow.”
ftf_6: Savannah Grey: “You can tap on the Spell card to select it, and add ingredients to make your spells even more incredible.”
ftf_7: Savannah Grey: “Tap on the Hex’s Glyph to cast it upon the selected target.”
ftf_8: Savannah Grey: “Well done! You have gained knowledge of your first spirit. You can also cast Hex from the Quickcast menu.”
ftf_9: Savannah Grey: “Spirits can be summoned to help you in many ways, but most importantly as companions inside Place of Power battles.”
ftf_10: Savannah Grey: “This is the Place of Power {locationName}. Witches congregate here to practice their spellcraft and compete for amazing rewards.”
ftf_11: Savannah Grey: “Let’s spectate the battle from a distance, witch.”
ftf_12: Savannah Grey: “Witches come from far and wide with exotic ingredients and spirits to claim victory over Places of Power.”
ftf_13: Savannah Grey: “This Place of Power is a Last Witch Standing battle, they must defeat the Guardian and each other to be victorious.”
ftf_14: Savannah Grey: “Places of Power just like the one you saw are spread out around the world.”
ftf_15: Savannah Grey: “Here you can see when upcoming Places of Power battles will take place. But beware, the farther you travel from your physical form, the weaker you become.”
ftf_16: Savannah Grey: “Tap here to assume spirit form and fly. You can fly anywhere in the world. Pinch to zoom and pan to search the world. Zoom in again to land."
ftf_17: Savannah Grey: “I think it’s time we introduce you to Madame Fortuna. She can provide you sufficient ingredients to get started…”
ftf_18: Madame Fortuna: “Sastipe, Dea Grey! It is always a pleasure my dear lady…”
ftf_19: Savannah Grey: “The pleasure is mine, dear friend. {witch name} is our newest witch; {he/she} needs a collection of ingredients for {his/her} spellcraft.”
ftf_20: Savannah Grey: “Abondia's Best collection added 1140 items to your inventory! You can collect a variety of items to empower your spellcraft from all over the world.”
ftf_21: Savannah Grey: “Well, witch, that's quite enough hand-holding. I officially welcome you to the {tribunalSeason} tournament of witchcraft. {tribunalDays} days remain.”
ftf_22: Savannah Grey: “This is just the beginning of your adventure. I strongly suggest you visit Witch School, but if you're the adventurous type, feel free to explore on your own.”
ftf_23: Savannah Grey: “As long as you abide by my rules, I'll continue to grant you a daily blessing of energy.”
spirit_behavior_assassin: Moves to and attacks vulnerable enemies nearby
spirit_behavior_familiar: Protects its summoner and fights with them
spirit_behavior_forbidden: Very aggressive spirit that can attack everything, including summoner and allies
spirit_behavior_guardian: Protects its summoning location; good for Places of Power and Portals
spirit_behavior_harvester: Collects nearby items of value for its summoner
spirit_behavior_healer: A spirit that blesses its summoner and allies
spirit_behavior_resurrector: Resurrects its summoner and allies in need
spirit_behavior_trickster: Unpredictable warrior spirit that casts a random spell on any witch
spirit_behavior_hunter: Moves to and attacks enemy spirits nearby
spirit_aatxe_desc: My life belongs to Mari. I am the rider of storms and keeper of Her earthly treasures.
spirit_abata_desc: I am queen of the marshes. The black waters are my dominion. Old secrets lie with me.
spirit_abchanchu_desc: I am old and gouty handed. Come close and I will share the wisdom of my days.
spirit_abeonaAdeona_desc: As sisters, we serve as guardians of wayward souls. We hold dominion over departures and wandering and give comfort to lost children.
spirit_abiku_desc: Never sated, I drink your spirit with relish. Where I traverse pestilence follows.
spirit_abkaHehe_desc: I am the triple goddess, mother of earth and light. I give birth to spirits of light and live to cast the wicked from the earthly plane.
spirit_abnoba_desc: Keeper of sacred springs and spirit of the deep forest. Born among the Celts I now travel the waters far and wide in the world.
spirit_acat_desc: Long venerated by the Mayans, I am patron to the artists of the flesh.
spirit_accaLarentia_desc: I am benefactress of my beloved Rome. A siren of the Seven Hills. Few spirits can match my wealth, none my beauty.
spirit_acheri_desc: The filth of mankind constitutes my life and my breath. I go as the child of innocent form, but my breath is disease.
spirit_aegir_desc: Primeval spirit of the sea, I was ancient when the earth still lived beneath the waves. I live to host and bring cheer to the halls of man and gods alike.
spirit_aeronwen_desc: From atop the old green hills I see the fate of battles before the first skull is cracked. I am a shield for those humble enough to call upon me.
spirit_aganyu_desc: My beating heart is fashioned from the black soil. I am a primordial dweller in the deepest quarters of the earth, when I lift my breath the earth heaves.
spirit_agni_desc: I am the Hindu God of Fire, Lightning, the Sun, and of Hearth. Perform a dance of fire in my honor and it will please me greatly.
spirit_agogwe_desc: You'll find me deep in the jungles of Africa. Some say I don't exist, and some say I do. It's up to you to find me and prove them wrong, or right.
spirit_agwe_desc: I am the loa of the sea, and patron of the sailors. My waters are free for your exploration, given that you protect them as I do.
spirit_ahool_desc: I ride the night winds on dusky wings. My cry is a call to the spirits of the night.
spirit_aife_desc: I am shaman, sorceress and maiden of the sword and lance. My love is war. My rival is Scatach, though I am her better.
spirit_aine_desc: My eyes are lit by the sun, the summer is my favored season, my bower is the sunlit glade.
spirit_alakshmi_desc: Don't confuse me with Lakshmi- I am the goddess of grief and despair. You won't have a happy experience if you encounter me.
spirit_alcyone_desc: Like Aeronwen I see what has not yet come to pass. The black hyded raven is my familiar and the speaker of my fortunes.
spirit_altamaha_desc: The base of the Altamaha River is my home. I live my life in secrecy and keep alive the legend of my existence.
spirit_aluqa_desc: I and my daughters are leechers of life drawing upon blood and spirit alike. We crawl as the insect and seduce as the irresistable maiden.
spirit_amFear_desc: I am the big grey man that wanders the passes of Ben MacDhui. Those that fear me do not know me, for I am a watchman for the adventurers of my realm.
spirit_amberella_desc: Once human, I am now the princess of the deep ocean. When I long to shore I will often leave gifts of amber in my wake.
spirit_ammit_desc: I am the devourer of the dead. I rest in the underworld, and feed off of the souls I call my meals.
spirit_andraste_desc: I am a bringer of luck, my presence is courage to the anxious. I was the wind behind Boudica's revolt. My devotees find victory in my inspiration.
spirit_angerboda_desc: I delight in the mystery of my true nature, for few among man know me well. I am a friend to witches, and give my guidance when I please. I have been known to travel in crow form.
spirit_angerona_desc: I am protectress of Rome and keeper of her secrets, I shall hold her true name for eternity.
spirit_anhanga_desc: I have known death, but death does not keep me. I can take many forms but favor the fire-eyed stag. I am only happy in wandering and sporting with frail human minds.
spirit_aoandon_desc: One hundred blue lanterns burn against the night. I will walk the edge of the shadows until the last light is spent. Your fear is my delight.
spirit_apep_desc: I am the bringer of chaos. The Underworld rumbles at the sound of my great roar, casting fear into the hearts of many.
spirit_apsara_desc: I am the dancer of the Gandharvas' music that echo deep in the gods' palaces. I provide entertainment and sometimes more to the magnificent.
spirit_ascalaphus_desc: I once pressed the orchard grass with my bare feet, now I crawl among the rocks. Pleasure abounds in the touch of the earth.
spirit_attercroppe_desc: I am the little poison head. My deeds are more mishief than malice. Upon my word, I promise good behavior.
spirit_aurora_desc: I am the spirit of the Northern Lights. People come to my domains to see my show and admire my gift of light.
spirit_austeja_desc: I am protectress of bees and guardian of families. I especially watch over women-with-child. Honey is sacred to me.
spirit_axehandle_desc: You'll find me wandering about in Minnesota and Wisconsin deep in the night. Be careful not to leave your axes out- you might find them handle-less by morning.
spirit_ayida_desc: I am the Rainbow Serpent, the loa of fertility, rainbows, wind, water, fire, and snakes. Offer me white eggs, rice, or milk and I will share with you my secrets.
spirit_ayizan_desc: I am the loa of marketplace and commerce. I keep with my many secrets and mysteries, to that which I will share with those who serve the Vodou correctly.
spirit_azaka_desc: I am the loa of the harvest. I am a kind and gentle soul who loves to eat; come, share a meal with me.
spirit_babaYaga_desc: I am no eater of children! They are far too stringy. My false reputation is owed to the deception of wicked step mothers, for I am a giver of justice and sharer of forest wisdom.
spirit_badbh_desc: I am the battle crow. I move easily between the realms of the living and the dead. I carry secrets of the otherworld, for a price.
spirit_bakeneko_desc: I am the silent feline. I am gentle, and you will hear the chirp of a cricket before you hear my approach.
spirit_bakru_desc: Made of flesh and yew, I am small but my heart is a clutch of flames. When I traffic among man I keep to passages and bridgeways.
spirit_baku_desc: I am the eater of foul dreams. Try my name three times and I will drink the nightmares from your brain.
spirit_banamuHehe_desc: I am the Earth Mother. I form a triad with Abka Hehe and Ulden Hehe. Respect nature, and you will have my gratitude.
spirit_banaspati_desc: Red of flesh and sharp of horn, I draw my strength from the anger of mankind. I wear your anger like a wreath of flame.
spirit_banshee_desc: I am born of the green glens of my ancient homeland, a sleeper of the mound. I am a watcher of noble families and sometimes sing the secrets of the dead.
spirit_baobhanSith_desc: I am come of the Scottish Highlands, but now journey the world over. The blood of huntsman is my drink of choice, his will is no match to my persuasion.
spirit_barghest_desc: I am a spectral hound loyal to my summoner. I will protect them with my life, and stay by their side at all times.
spirit_befana_desc: I've been carrying gifts to the young since the ancient times. I keep my home in the forests of Italy.
spirit_begtse_desc: I once rode as the lord of war spiriting the horde of Genghis Khan! I still serve as the guardian of Mongolia, but I'm always up for an adventure!
spirit_belenus_desc: Once beloved as a shining deity, I am enjoying an age of peaceful obscurity. I keep to my flocks in the sunlit meadows, but I may be called upon for spiritual errands.
spirit_belieBelcan_desc: I am a shield to honorable witches and devoted to the service of my summoner.
spirit_benten_desc: I am daughter of the dragon king. I dwell beneath Lake Biwa by Kyoto. If love is your purpose, I shall guide you.
spirit_bigfoot_desc: It is I, the legend itself. Some will see me wandering in the woods, some will mistake me, and some will say I do not exist. Only the wisest will know the truth.
spirit_boggart_desc: Mishcief is my game. I make my home in the houses of man. I may turn your milk or hobble your hound, but malicious? Never in life!
spirit_booHag_desc: I am the skinless skin thief. I often walk in others' skins, hiding my true raw self. My victims' breaths are my blood, giving me power and life.
spirit_boromu_desc: I am a lord of ash and desiccation. I am coughed from the stomachs of old gods. I bring withering and weakness upon mankind.
spirit_brockenSpectre_desc: I am the spirit of The Brocken. Let your eyes rest upon me and my form shall become a mirror of your soul.
spirit_bruxaEvora_desc: I am more wise and more beautiful than any living witch. I am a wellspring of mystic knowledge and will share secrets in return for adulation.
spirit_buda_desc: I am the power of the Evil Eye. Often in the form of a hyena, I will stalk my victims and show them my true nature.
spirit_bunyip_desc: I thrive in the dark waters of Australia. Rumors of my wicked nature are false, for I care little for the ways of man. For those few that I favor I will give protection.
spirit_caipora_desc: I prefer to keep to the shadowy fastness of the forests, turning my feet to trick my followers. While I have little concern for man, the right gift can earn my favor.
spirit_callisto_desc: In my spirit form I come as the bear. My voice is weak but my strength is formidable. Honey and sweets will bring out the best in my temperament.
spirit_camazotz_desc: I am the Snatch Bat, a black winged agent of death. The noble heroes of Maya were no match for me, what makes you think you'll have a chance?
spirit_catSidhe_desc: There can be no more gentle companion to witches. I am here to serve.
spirit_chantico_desc: The flames of time light my spirit. At rest, I take the form of the red serpent. I am a willing guardian of witches.
spirit_charities_desc: I have served witches old and young for centuries. I am one of the noble Graces, but you need not be noble to win my favor.
spirit_chelone_desc: Once a nymph of the mountain passes, I now enjoy my days in the form of a turtle. Never interfere with the love affairs of gods.
spirit_choncon_desc: The span of my wings will conceal the stars above you as I hunt the moonless night, and as your loved ones slumber, I will nourish from their blood.
spirit_chthonian_desc: I am a spirit of the earth, I prefer to keep my time upon the surface to a minimum.
spirit_chupacabra_desc: I was first sighted in Puerto Rico, then made my way to the United States to feed on the abundance of livestock. This has earned me the name "the goatsucker."
spirit_cindaku_desc: I have the mind of man and the form of the tiger. While my history with man has been turbulent, I will occasionally serve a capable witch with a good cause.
spirit_cipelahq_desc: I am the fierce eyed spirit of the night. I come as prince of owls, my cries cause mothers to hush their babes.
spirit_coventina_desc: I take my strength from the sacred springs of Northumberland. I owe my healing powers to these waters.
spirit_curupira_desc: I delight in the animals and plants of the wild, but perhaps I delight in confounding the axman, poacher, and those harmful the nature just a bit more.
spirit_dapperSkeleton_desc: I am the mascot of the Day of the Dead. Although my origins are in Mexico, influence and culture has brought me around the globe to share my dapperness with all.
spirit_djab_desc: I am an unabashed spirit for hire, here to provide magical talents to the highest bidder.
spirit_djinn_desc: We are old and many, fashioned of flames we are masters of many forms. We are a moody race, let us hope that you've caught me at the right time.
spirit_dropBear_desc: Do not mistake me for my gentle cousin, for I am not so meek. Please me and I serve as an able guardian of sacred places.
spirit_dryad_desc: I come of an old and noble race. Arbiters of the wood, I am made strong from the sinews of the forest. To serve as your protrectress you have much to prove.
spirit_edimmu_desc: We served the vanguard of the Ember Wars. Now, the sweet blood of witches cries to us once more.
spirit_indio_desc: I am an ancestral guardian of brave adventurers. If you bore me, witch, I will find another.
spirit_evilWind_desc: I am the Last of the Seven. I am the Storm, the Evil Wind, and I take my vengeance.
spirit_farDarrig_desc: I'm no chancer puttin on airs. I'm the original Red Man and up for layin boots on whoever stands before me.
spirit_fossegrimen_desc: I am the water fiddler. Give me a satisfying meal and I will be happy to share the secrets of my melodies.
spirit_fowler_desc: I have served human witches for centuries. I am a keen and cunning protector, albeit with a mind of my own. I stand against demonkind, but it is the vampire that I truly loath.
spirit_fuath_desc: My name means "hate" in Scottish Gaelic. Assume my personality the same.
spirit_fudo_desc: I am the Immutable One. The wisdom of many years grants me patience. With my rope I bind the wicked.
spirit_fukusuke_desc: I am a princely agent of good fortune. Prosperity thrives in my presence. The ringing of the merchant's bell pleases me.
spirit_furiousWolf_desc: I am the Fifth of the Seven. I am the Furious Wolf, who knoweth not flee. Challenge me, and see who is the last to make a stand.
spirit_gabija_desc: Regarded as the Lithuanian spirit of fire, I am the protector of home and family. I take many forms, most commonly a cat, stork, or rooster.
spirit_gashadokuro_desc: I am the starving skeleton. Wander into my sight and I will feed on your blood.
spirit_glaistig_desc: Don't confuse me with Fuath. I am beautiful yet also monstrous, the Green Lady with the lower end of a goat.
spirit_goatman_desc: I was once an esteemed scientist who fell victim to an experiment gone wrong. Now I'm cursed with the legs and head of a goat. Please don't come for me, for I wish to remain in isolation until my misery comes to an end.
spirit_greatDragon_desc: I am the Second of the Seven. I am the Great Dragon, whose mouth is wide open. None can measure to my true and raw strength.
spirit_leopard_desc: I am the Third of the Seven. I am the Grim Leopard, who carries off the young. Keep them safe and away from me, for I take any and everything in my sight.
spirit_grindylow_desc: I am deeply misunderstund, for my old kinsman have stained my name. Call upon me and I shall prove myself a worthy companion to witches.
spirit_hitotsume_desc: I am the Japanese cyclops. Give me a block of tofu and I will forever be your friend.
spirit_houndAnnwn_desc: No longer in service of my old Lord Annwn, I am ready to lead your hunt. Let the night not hold us back, for we have the blessing of Matilda!
spirit_huldra_desc: My long golden hair houses my crown of flowers. I promise you, I am beautiful, but so many can't look past my wretched cow's tail. Please, somebody wed me so I can be free of it.
spirit_hyosube_desc: If I make my home in yours, prepare to clean up my grimey, mucky hair from your, now my, bathtub.
spirit_inugami_desc: Be careful not to mistake me from an ordinary canine. The level of loyalty I provide depends on the jingle of change in your pocket.
spirit_itzamna_desc: Lord of Night and Day, I am the first healer and patron to the scribes. I have little time for upstart witches.
spirit_itzpapalotl_desc: I am the Obsidian Butterfly, made of the bones of Mictlan and ruler of the realm of Tamoanchan.
spirit_jackolantern_desc: Carve a happy face, carve a scary face, it doesn't matter to me. Use a candle or a light, on the porch or in the street. Just be sure to mutter the words, "Trick or Treat!"
spirit_jerseyDevil_desc: The Pine Barrens of New Jersey is my home. I move quickly, and emit a blood-curdling scream unlike no other. Are you quick enough to catch me?
spirit_jikininki_desc: I will smile when I am fat with the flesh and blood of all the dead.
spirit_jurupari_desc: I am the Jurupari and you may find my words are as winding as the paths I hide beyond. You may never see my crooked smile, but you will feel it in your slumber.
spirit_kalku_desc: I am the dark shaman and the master of strife. If I am not enough to frighten you I can always introduce you to my servants Anchimayen and Chonchon.
spirit_kamaitachi_desc: I am the sickle weasel. I attack in threes, so fast that death arrives before you see my spiny fur shift.
spirit_kappa_desc: I am the river child. I make my home in the ponds and streams, protecting the dish-like depression on my head. Let it go dry, and I will no longer serve you.
spirit_katawaguruma_desc: I roll upon the roads of Japan on a flaming ox-cart wheel. Don't let my method of travel fool you. Get too close and I'll devour your soul.
spirit_kek_desc: I am not the frog you may be thinking of. I am the Egyptian representation of night and day. If you come here to converse about my representation in this new world, keep walking.
spirit_kesari_desc: I am a brave vanara once regarded as a chief. I am noted as the slayer of Shambasadana and will continue to challenge wicked monsters alike.
spirit_kijo_desc: Don't wonder into my mountains and caves. I will devour anything and anyone who sets foot in my territory.
spirit_kirin_desc: You may only ever see me with the purest of heart. I will never appear to the wicked as I value life and purity above all else. If you find yourself consumed by my holy fire, yours is a truly dark heart.
spirit_kitsune_desc: I am the fox that punishes wicked holy men, the dishonest, and arrogance. Though, I may enjoy a friendly prank now and then.
spirit_lakshmi_desc: I am the goddess of wealth, fortune, and prosperity. Honor me and your burdens may disappear.
spirit_lalechusa_desc: Don't believe in me? Whistle three times at the bell of midnight and you may find out.
spirit_lamia_desc: Mothers beware, summon me and I may eat your children and steal your husbands.
spirit_lares_desc: Call me to your hearth and I will gentle your heart, bless your crops, and protect your sacred places.
spirit_lobisomem_desc: I am the shapeshifter.  The savage wolf is hidden within my human form, until I loose the Beast.
spirit_lubana_desc: Don't let my appearance fool you, as I tell no lies. I will cleanse a wayward man and bring order by  dominating any situation.
spirit_brigitte_desc: I am the goddess of life, death, and everything in between. I am depicted with fire and snakes, and represent the various saints of such.
spirit_mahamba_desc: Some say I'm a relic of the mosasaur, some say I'm just a giant crocodile. I don't like boats or rafts in my waters, and will devour them with no hesitation. You have been warned.
spirit_mamiWaters_desc: Sailors of Africa recognize me as a wonderous water deity. I protect the vast rivers and oceans of the land, deeming it safe for all.
spirit_manticore_desc: Am I a lion? Am I human? Am I a scorpion? Or am I simply wise? Call on me, decide for yourself and I will protect you and your lesser spirits.
spirit_mapinguari_desc: Wretched are the cursed, for they shall inherint misery. The gods themselves have seen to mine.
spirit_mare_desc: I am the source of your nightmares. While you sleep I sit on your chest, bringing about your worst fears in the inescapable tomb of sleep.
spirit_maximon_desc: A glass filled with spirits, and a cigar in hand is the proper way to gain my attention.  Tell me your desires for I'm friends with the Saints.
spirit_mazomba_desc: In the Tanzanian waters you may find me swimming about. I am giant, I am great. I will leave you be, should you return the favor.
spirit_mishipeshu_desc: I rule the creatures of water both shallow and deep.  At my command the waves tower, and the wind will thrash the land. I'm unlikely to suffer your presence.
spirit_moonSnake_desc: I am the dream bringer, for I am poured from the white breast of the mother moon. I am fond of witches and will serve at your leisure.
spirit_mothman_desc: I am the Winged Man of West Virginia. Some have seen me on bridges, others have seen me soaring above. Since my first sighting in 1966, many have theorized about my wherabouts and origins. I'm out there, I promise you, waiting and watching for the one who is strong enough to master me.
spirit_mujina_desc: I am the badger who enjoys a little bit of fun. Please don't be afraid, for I mean you no harm. I strive only to trick and play.
spirit_myobu_desc: My fur is as white as snow, as fluffy as the clouds. I am a holy being, meant only for your admiration.
spirit_nilith_desc: The smell of a human disgusts me. Come to my icy domain and see what exactly I'm capable of.
spirit_nisser_desc: Much like Befana, I am a gift giver to all. I am a generous little being similar to that of a garden gnome. Treat me well and I will protect you and your family from evil and misfortune.
spirit_nokken_desc: From beneath the Lilly Pad I wait, watching for your hand, or simply your long hair to touch the surface when you reach for the blooming flower.  I'll likely keep you below for a while.
spirit_onamazu_desc: As I swim in the mud beneath the Islands, the earth may shake and thrash about. I mean not to cause harm; my sheer might is difficult to suppress.
spirit_oni_desc: Reborn with tusk, horn, and the desire to further brutalize mankind after living a truly wicked human life, my pleasure is to punish your existence.
spirit_ouni_desc: Treat me kindly, feed me a meal, and give me a place to stay and I will be sure to reward you handsomely. I will vanish without a trace, and return to my lonely mountain to await my next visit.
spirit_pesta_desc: I am the great disease. I am the silent killer. I am the manifestation of the Black Death itself.
spirit_piasa_desc: I am the great dragon seen above in the American plains. The natives of the portraited me on the bluffs of the Mississippi River. Come by and marvel at my magnificence.
spirit_pisadeira_desc: Resting for the night on a full stomach is my invitation. If you are lucky enough to survive my strangle's grasp, I will surely be back for more.
spirit_pukwudgie_desc: I am the vanishing little wild man of the woods. If you're quick enough, you can find me in Delaware. Don't blame me for what comes next.
spirit_quetzalcoatl_desc: I am the winged serpent and giver of life.  My affection for you is boundless.
spirit_rampant_desc: I am the Sixth of the Seven. I am the Rampant, the vicious lion, who marches against god and king.
spirit_redMan_desc: Good luck becomes the norm if you associate with me, but you'll have to be able to withstand a bit o me mirth first.
spirit_redcap_desc: I dwell in the ruins of tyranny.  With sharpened teeth, ghoulish nails, and by bludgeoning, I murder alongside the dark memories of wicked deeds.  Beware. My cap must soak in the blood that spills from your veins.
spirit_ryeWolf_desc: Blood thirsty, ruthless, and relentless once I've your scent.  Loyal to my kind.
spirit_saci_desc: You know the days that everything goes wrong? It pleases me to be responsible for each and every bit of it. I dare you to take my red hat.
spirit_sentinelOwl_desc: Only the clever will benefit from my silent gaze.
spirit_shezmu_desc: I am often depicted as a man with a lion's head. I hold my butcher knife close, ready to strike at anyone who threatens me.
spirit_shojo_desc: I love the sweet taste of any alcohol upon my lips. Bring me a drink and we will be friends for a lifetime.
spirit_sidhe_desc: Under the emerald hills of Eire I dwell, but should you locate me viewing the sky, I'll bless you with harp, song, story, and love, for I'm masters of all.
spirit_southWind_desc: I am the First of the Seven. I am the South Wind, the horrible Storm with a thirst for destruction.
spirit_stingyJack_desc: I am the lonesome traveller, banned from both Heaven and Hell. With only a hallowed turnip to light my way, I wonder the world for the rest of eternity. Stumble upon me and I will share with you the stories of my time.
spirit_strigoi_desc: I can turn myself into any breathing creature, or dismiss myself from the human eye. I can take what I want with ease, and not a witch can stop me.
spirit_strix_desc: It matters not how far you flee. I smell your blood from leagues away, and will stop at nothing to quench my thirst.
spirit_tanuki_desc: I'm built for hijinks of every sort.  It's unwise to cavort with me, but I promise fun if you do.  Simply point me to a source of amusement.
spirit_tengu_desc: I am Tengu, the master of martial arts. I am a shape-shifter, and can transform into any human or animal I choose.
spirit_shibbu_desc: I am the Fourth of the Seven. I am the Terrible Shibbu, a deadly snake which slithers quietly. Nobody will hear the snap of my fangs until it's too late.
spirit_thunderBird_desc: You hear the thunder of my wings, and see the lightning that I command. I am often carved in my admirer's totems.
spirit_tlaloc_desc: I am the Aztec God of Rain. A proper offering to me is a burned incense of yauhtli. You can find my stories hidden deep beneath Teotihuacan.
spirit_tzitzimitl_desc: I am the deity of the stars. I'm often depicted as a skeletal female wearing a skull and crossbones patterened skirt. My leader is Itzpapalotl, the Obsidian Butterfly.
spirit_uldenHehe_desc: I am the Light Mother. I form a triad with Abka Hehe and Banamu Hehe. I will guide your way in the dark and lead you to safety.
spirit_undine_desc: Once the attendant of the sea god Poseidon I shift my form from water to flesh with ease.  Secrets I have, and secrets I'll share if you'll join me beneath the shimmering surface.
spirit_vila_desc: Comely and seductive in my native wilds I whisper and the winds obey. Do not misjudge me, the earth trembles when I bring war.
spirit_wanderingHead_desc: Standing with my back to you, you cannot see my lunatic grin.  As you near, my body slips into the earth until only my head remains, which I will then turn to you so that I can witness your terror.  Run, if you will, I am quicker than you think.
spirit_wendigo_desc: My kingdom is the forests of the high north. Disturb me if you dare; blood and fear and desperation will undoubtedly follow.
spirit_whiteLady_desc: Mournfully, and but for the occasional wail, I quietly haunt this place. I'm attached to the building, to the grounds, but cannot always tell you why.  Please, do not pursue me. Your life causes me distress.
spirit_xochipilli_desc: I adore your mortality and find happiness in your creative soul.  Join me amongst the flowers to dance, to follow the sun, and in all that is beautiful.
spirit_xolotl_desc: Few gods are special enough to be formed with the eyeless head of a dog, and a perfectly deformed body, but I am.  Nor are others permitted to lead the sun through the night realm so that it might rise again come dawn. Might, I say.  You will only find misfortune should our paths cross.
spirit_xtabay_desc: My song a sweet temptation, come to me beneath the ceiba tree.
spirit_yamanba_desc: Come, take a seat by the fire and take a load off. Come close and hear the stories I have to tell.
spirit_yatagarasu_desc: I am the three legged crow. I inhabit the sun and form a dark shadow seen from the earth when I spread my wings.
spirit_yukiOnna_desc: I am winter, irresistable to your eye, hoarfrost upon my breath, and envious of your warmth.  I am your irreversible end.
spirit_yunwiTsunsdi_desc: I am one of the Little People of the Cherokees. I am sometimes referred to as a dwarf or a fairy. While this is incorrect, I still strive to help the respectful and kind.
spirit_zarabanda_desc: I am the messanger to the underworld. Through my undying might, one can open their world to the other side.
spirit_zashiki_desc: I am the friendly house spirit. Open your doors to me and I will assure riches come to you and your family.

cosmetic_f_S_HKO_purchase: The Japanese kimono is believed to have been adopted during the Kofun period in between 300 and 500 A.D. It has been modified into a unique clothing style that is typically worn during traditional and formal ceremonies. Kimonos are regarded as artistic creations and are frequently decorated with beautiful floral or geometric patterns.
cosmetic_f_S_HLO_purchase: The leopard print has traditionally been considered a status of wealth and status, particularly for aristocratic members of the Kingdom of Benin. The gele is a traditional headpiece of the Edo people, the descendents of the founders of this kingdom.
cosmetic_f_S_SNOWQUEEN_purchase: The Snow Queen is the titular character from Hans Christian Anderson's 19th century fairy tale, whose kiss lures a child far from home.
cosmetic_m_S_HHO_purchase: The original witch doctors were said to heal ordinary people from curses inflicted by malicious witches.
cosmetic_m_S_HKO_purchase: The Japanese kimono is believed to have been adopted during the Kofun period in between 300 and 500 A.D. It has been modified into a unique clothing style that is typically worn during traditional and formal ceremonies. Kimonos are regarded as artistic creations and are frequently decorated with beautiful floral or geometric patterns.
cosmetic_m_S_HLO_purchase: For the ancient Egyptians, magic was a constant presence in their daily life; it balanced their universe and brought harmony in life and in death. The ancient Egyptian god of magic was called Heka, and his power was so great that he was feared even by the other gods.
cosmetic_m_S_JACKFROST_purchase: The personification of winter, Jack Frost is traditionally said to leave frost patterns on windows on cold nights.
cosmetic_m_S_FIREDANCER_purchase: The Summer solstice marks the longest day of the year for the Northern Hemisphere. Many celebrate by dancing around fires to honor the sun and drive out evil. Crops approach their full maturity during this time. A good Solstice celebration means a plentiful harvest to come.
cosmetic_f_S_LILYOV_purchase: The Summer solstice marks the longest day of the year for the Northern Hemisphere. Many celebrate by dancing around fires to honor the sun and drive out evil. Crops approach their full maturity during this time. A good Solstice celebration means a plentiful harvest to come.
cosmetic_f_S_CALYPSO_purchase: The Crop Over festival in Barbados is a lively, colorful event celebrating their generous cultivation of sugarcane. Kadooment Day is the final day of the festival. Masquerade bands playing Calypso music and dancers decorated in jewels and feathers honor the end with an animated parade.

cosmetic_f_S_CORNMOON_purchase: A full moon comes yet again. August 15th marks the Green Corn moon, also called the Sturgeon moon because the namesake fish were plentiful at this time. Witches on the White Path will be at their strongest any time a full moon takes the sky.
cosmetic_m_S_CORNMOON_purchase: A full moon comes yet again. August 15th marks the Green Corn moon, also called the Sturgeon moon because the namesake fish were plentiful at this time. Witches on the White Path will be at their strongest any time a full moon takes the sky.
cosmetic_f_S_BRNNGWTCH_purchase: The Burning Man festival takes place in the Black Rock Desert of Nevada; it is a celebration of creativity, self-reliance, and unconditional gift-giving. The event culminates with the burning of a large, wooden effigy in the shape of a man.
cosmetic_m_S_BRNNGWTCH_purchase: The Burning Man festival takes place in the Black Rock Desert of Nevada; it is a celebration of creativity, self-reliance, and unconditional gift-giving. The event culminates with the burning of a large, wooden effigy in the shape of a man.
cosmetic_f_S_MABON_purchase: The Mabon Festival is a time of gratitude to celebrate the Pagan Autumn Equinox. During this time, life and death meet as summer becomes winter. Witches don their finest clothing and make offerings of wine, cider, and herbs to give thanks for the balance provided by the seasons.
cosmetic_f_S_SAMHAIN_purchase: Samhain is an ancient Celtic-pagan tradition, held in modern times from October 31 until November 1 to celebrate the harvest and welcome the changing of the seasons. Spirits were thought to take different shapes around this time of year due to repeated sightings of Lady Gwyn, a headless woman dressed in white who would chase any who chose to wander at night, often accompanied by a black pig.
cosmetic_f_S_HECATE_purchase: Hecate is the Greek goddess of witchcraft, necromancy, and cross roads. The Hecate Trivia Festival usually depicts the goddess with three faces since the word trivia means “the place where three roads meet” in latin. Myths often depict her as a “guide of souls,” making worshipers build shrines to the goddess to drive away the undead and restless spirits.
cosmetic_f_S_DIWALI_purchase: Diwali is India’s most important holiday, often called the “Festival of Lights,” symbolizing the triumph of light over darkness or good over evil. During the weeks leading up to the celebration, homes are cleaned, renovated, and decorated with flowers and bright lights. The rituals last for five days as people adorn themselves in their finest clothing, illuminate the inside and outside of their houses with oil candles, and throw family feasts as they give thanks for their continued prosperity.
cosmetic_f_S_SOOTHSAYER_purchase: The word “soothe” is an archaic word that translates to truth or reality, meaning those with the sight had the ability to see future events and give those without the sight a true perspective. Soothsayers read cards, palms, crystal balls, and even the stars as a way to foretell future events although some don’t have a need for these objects to access their abilities.
cosmetic_f_S_DAYOFDEAD_purchase: Day of the dead or “Dia de los Muertos” is a Mexican holiday where deceased loved ones return to the world of the living to visit with their families. It is viewed as a celebration, where families make altars filled with the favorite foods and beverages of the deceased and decorate the grave in colorful flowers. People living in the mountains of central Mexico see a rise in Monarch butterflies around this time of year, making them believe the butterflies to be the spirits of the dead.
cosmetic_m_S_MABON_purchase: The Mabon Festival is a time of gratitude to celebrate the Pagan Autumn Equinox. During this time, life and death meet as summer becomes winter. cosmetic_m_S_SAMHAIN_purchase: Samhain is an ancient Celtic-pagan tradition, held in modern times from October 31 until November 1 to celebrate the harvest and welcome the changing of the seasons. The Dullahan appear as an impish creature or as a headless man carrying their head in one arm while riding a horse with flaming eyes. Encountering a Dullahan was thought to be an omen of death during Samhain.
cosmetic_m_S_HECATE_purchase: Hermes is the messenger of the gods. Both Hermes and Hekate are connected by the goddess Persephone and the underworld; Hermes was sent to the underworld to retrieve Persephone and Hekate accompanied Demeter with her torches in her quest to save her daughter from the clutches of Hades.

cosmetic_m_S_SLPPYHLLW_purchase: The Headless Horseman was a soldier whose head was shot off by a cannonball in the town of Sleepy Hollow during the American Revolutionary War. Every night he can be heard riding his horse to the scene of his death, in constant search for his head. Those who encounter his spectre in the night offer suffer his wrath, losing their lives as well as their heads.
cosmetic_f_S_YULE_purchase: Yule or Christmastide is a twelve day festival that starts after the first day of Winter, lasting from December 22 until January 2. It was historically celebrated by Germanic people but evolved over time and is the origin of many modern day Christmas traditions such as, most famously, the Yule log. The burning of the yule log symbolizes the triumph of good over evil, the brighter the fire burns, the weaker evil forces become. The witch who wears this style will feel the warmth of the burning Yule log as long as they wear it.

cosmetic_f_S_NVRMR_purchase: The Nevermore style was created in honor of the great America poet, Edgar Allen Poe, who made his mark during the Romantic period. Through his works, he exposes readers to the macabre present in human nature and expresses the grief he experienced over much of his life. The witch who wears this style will often hear the raven on their shoulder whispering “nevermore” softly in their ear.

cosmetic_f_S_PLGDCTR_purchase: The most famous depiction of the plague itself are the outfits worn by the doctors who treated its victims in the 17th century. Their outfits were made up of a waxed fabric overcoat, a pouch of medicines on their belt, and a mask with glass eye openings that also had a beak shaped nose. Similar to the idea of a gas mask, the nose was often stuffed with herbs, straw, and spices to protect the doctor from breathing in the “bad air” that afflicted their patients.

bundle_abondiasBest_desc: An ideal collection for the young witch walking the sunlit path. Guaranteed to have more than a dozen choice Signatures for magnificent results! (1140 items included)
bundle_sapphosChoice_desc: Save yourself the trouble of flying the world over to gather tools or dig for roots. We've done the hard work! This collection is specially curated for the witch that works within the shadows. (1125 items included)
bundle_hermeticCollection_desc: For the lover of mischief and grey magics this collection is an homage to Hermes, the trickster of tricksters. Ideal for those on the grey path. (1125 items included)
garden_bellWitch_desc: Here is the chosen ground of the legendary barrow sister known as the Bell Witch. This old sister has made too many bargains with agents of the Underworld to be trusted. While this area will provide in plenty, we do not recommend you stay for long. There is little warning when the Bell Witch will rise from her grotto.
garden_brockenMountain_desc: A favorite haunt for witches since ancient times. It is here that a coven of Pythagorean disciples perfected the earliest forms of astral projection. We know them now as the first Greek shamans. Before their final soul-journey, they consecrated the Brocken as a bastion for all future magic workers. It served as a chosen staging ground for witches during the Ember Wars.
garden_crossroadsAmerica_desc: Beneath the concrete and neon of this urban jungle magical energies converge to form one of the major crossroads of the modern world. Such convergence creates a wellspring of spiritual and magical powers and quickens the heart's blood of every witch that gathers here.
garden_crossroadsAncient_desc: Modern-day Kabul is built on the crossroads of the ancient world. The veil has long been thin in this realm allowing Otherworldly spirits easy passage into our world. If we trust the Sons of Enoch, it is here that around 1608 the great Italian covens gathered to form the hive "Good Walkers" and banished the evil Duke Murmur back to the Underworld.
garden_nakagusukuRift_desc: Toil and trouble abound in this realm. The Sons of Enoch claim this grove was home to a clan of figurine-carvers that with imperial patronage studied the art of necromancy in the hope to animate fallen ancestors of the royal family. They proved to be master carvers, but their mediation with the dead only served to corrupt the land of Nakagusuku.
garden_fengdu_desc: The King of Hell may have left the door open, for the Mingshan Mountain is trafficked by spirits as well as demonkind. Witches should not dwell too long in this city of ghosts. Should you choose to harvest here, do so by day.
garden_hellfireClub_desc: The Brass Castle, on top of Montpelier Hill was made with the stones of nearby ancient graves. This caused the spirits to lash out and grow restless in the surrounding area. The hill is home to the paranormal and where members of the occult come to gather.
garden_lostLaNoria_desc: The desert wind soughs through the ruins of old La Noria, whispering the names of the many who have died here. This is a quiet land; a land of sadness; a land of ghosts. A knowing witch may find counsel with the languishing spirits of La Noria, and wisdom in such counsel, but beware the demons that feed upon their sadness.
garden_xunantunich_desc: Early explorers noticed a woman in white with glowing red eyes ascending the stairs of the Castillo and disappearing into a stone wall. Xunantunich was thereafter named for her and means "the stone woman" in Mayan. Is she a priestess? Was the young man buried in the temple her lover? Whoever she is, she's powerful and draws many spirits to the once wealthy citadel.
garden_hoghtonBottoms_desc: The fortified manor house Hoghton Tower was originally built in 1109 by Harvey de Walter, a William the Conqueror companion. Over the years it's hosted numerous royalty, Shakespeare and Dickens among others. Some visitors never leave, however, such as the laughing girl, the monk by the north tower, and the lady in green. As one of the most haunted locations in England, this is a rich hunting ground for enterprising witches.
garden_groveAricia_desc: The worship of Diana Nemorensis, or "Diana of the Wood" was brought to Lake Nemi by King Orestes. Legend has it any stranger who set foot on the island was sacrificed on her altar. A sacred grove occupied ground that later became an Etruscan temple. This is a magical place where a witch might gather power or a freedom granting branch if you are quick.
garden_mountHekla_desc: Mount Hekla is known for its volcanic activity that poisons native herds with its deadly residues. Some believe condemned souls travel the volcanic tunnels to the crater on their way to hell. The volcanic ridge is twenty-five miles long giving witches a lucrative path to harvest or commune with the dead, but not all souls are willing to suffer the living.
